intro: Aidia endertii, commonly known as the Ender's aidia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aidia endertii is considered a species of conservation concern.
